text: The Richard J. Daley Center or The Daley Center is a civic center in the city of Chicago, Illinois. The center is named after Mayor Richard J. Daley. The building is 648 feet (198 meters) 30 store building. The Daley Center was opened in 1965. The center has a sculpture, Chicago Picasso made by Pablo Picasso. ==References== ==Other websites== * City of Chicago * Cook County * Richard J. Daley Center on Emporis * Daley Plaza Eternal Flame Category:Skyscrapers in Chicago Category:1965 establishments in the United States Category:1960s establishments in Illinois
title: Richard J. Daley Center
